qas.question: What trait do people most commonly link red with?
Why did the Popes of the middle ages wear red?

answers.text: to symbolize the blood of Christ and the Christian martyrs

qas.question: What was depicted on the banners of Christians in the First crusade?

answers.text: a red cross on a white field

qas.question: What is the cross on the banners used during the First Crusade known as?
Who was Saint George believed to be?

plausible_answers.text: to symbolize the blood of Christ and the Christian martyrs.

qas.question: Why is the color red worn in the Catholic Church?

plausible_answers.text: red cross on a white field

qas.question: What was the banner of the Catholic soldiers in the First Crusade?
What is the Catholic cross of the First Crusade called?

plausible_answers.text: a Roman soldier who was a member of the guards of the Emperor Diocletian, who refused to renounce his Christian faith and was martyred.

qas.question: Who was Saint George according to Catholic tradition?
What cross became the Roman flag in the 16th century?

context: Surveys show that red is the color most associated with <a0_0>courage<a0_0/>. In western countries red is a symbol of martyrs and sacrifice, particularly because of its association with blood. Beginning in the Middle Ages, the Pope and Cardinals of the Roman Catholic Church wore red <a1_0><b5_0>to symbolize the blood of Christ and the Christian martyrs<a1_0/>.<b5_0/> The banner of the Christian soldiers in the First Crusade was <a2_0>a <b6_0>red cross on a white field<b6_0/><a2_0/>, <b7_0>the <a3_0>St. George's Cross<b7_0/><a3_0/>. According to Christian tradition, Saint George was <a4_0><b8_0>a Roman soldier<a4_0/> who was a member of the guards of the Emperor Diocletian, who refused to renounce his Christian faith and was martyred.<b8_0/> <b9_0>The Saint George's Cross<b9_0/> became the Flag of England in the 16th century, and now is part of the Union Flag of the United Kingdom, as well as the Flag of the Republic of Georgia.
